channel.title: The Writer's Almanac
channel.description: The Writer's Almanac is a daily podcast of poetry and historical interest pieces, usually of literary significance. Each day's offering is five minutes long and contains "on this day in history" information as well as an accessible poem.
channel.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
channel.itunes:subtitle: The five-minute history and poetry podcast
channel.itunes:summary: The Writer's Almanac is a daily podcast of poetry and historical interest pieces, usually of literary significance. Each day's offering is five minutes long and contains "on this day in history" information as well as an accessible poem.

item.title: The Writers Almanac for Sunday, May 29, 2022
item.description: Today is the birthday of President John F. Kennedy, born in 1917. He said to his fellow Americans “ask not what your country can do for you — ask what you can do for your country."
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: Today is the birthday of President John F. Kennedy, born in 1917. He said to his fellow Americans “ask not what your country can do for you — ask what you can do for your country."
item.itunes:summary: Today is the birthday of President John F. Kennedy, born in 1917. He said to his fellow Americans “ask not what your country can do for you — ask what you can do for your country."

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Saturday, May 28, 2022
item.description: Today is the birthday of the man who created James Bond, novelist Ian Fleming, born in London, England in 1908.
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions

item.itunes:summary: Today is the birthday of the man who created James Bond, novelist Ian Fleming, born in London, England in 1908.

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Friday, May 27, 2022
item.description: It’s the birthday of the American poet who once said, “The public needs poetry; I need poetry, to help celebrate and console.” Linda Pastan, born in 1932.
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s the birthday of the American poet who once said, “The public needs poetry; I need poetry, to help celebrate and console.” Linda Pastan, born in 1932.

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Thursday, May 26, 2022
item.description: Today is the birthday of photographer Dorothea Lange, 1895, whose photo “Migrant Mother” is one of the most iconic images of the Great Depression.
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: Today is the birthday of photographer Dorothea Lange, 1895, whose photo “Migrant Mother” is one of the most iconic images of the Great Depression.

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Wednesday, May 25, 2022
item.description: “People tend to blame a writer for writing something they’re too stupid to understand.” – Jamaica Kincaid, celebrating her 73rd birthday today.
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: “People tend to blame a writer for writing something they’re too stupid to understand.” – Jamaica Kincaid, celebrating her 73rd birthday today.

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Tuesday, May 24, 2022
item.description: “There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.” – Joseph Brodsky, poet, born on this day in 1940.
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: “There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.” – Joseph Brodsky, poet, born on this day in 1940.

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Monday, May 23, 2022
item.description: Poet Jane Kenyon would be 75 on this day had she not died of leukemia in 1995. We hear her poem “Philosophy in Warm Weather.”

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Sunday, May 22, 2022
item.description: It is the birthday of Harvey Milk (1930), the first openly gay man elected to public office. He was assassinated in 1978 about a year after his election to City Supervisor.
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Saturday, May 21, 2022
item.description: On this day in 1881, Clara Barton founded the American Red Cross. Clara Barton said, "I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them."
item.itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions

item.title: The Writer's Almanac for Friday, May 20, 2022
item.description: On this day in 1946 English-born poet, W.H. Auden became a U.S. citizen. "It's a sad fact about our culture that a poet can earn much more money writing or talking about his art than he can by practicing it."

item.title: The Writer's Almanac - Sunday, May 9, 2021
item.description: It’s the 100th birthday of Pulitzer Prize-winning poet Mona Van Duyn (1921). She said, "I believe that good poetry can be as ornate as a cathedral or as bare as a pottingshed, as long as it confronts the self with honesty and fullness.”

item.title: The Writer's Almanac - Tuesday, March 31, 2020

It starts when you care
to act, it starts when you do
it again after they said No,
it starts when you say We…
–from today’s poem by Marge Piercy
